summary: PGY3-HUB isHeadless Error Testing - CRITICAL ISSUE IDENTIFIED: The isHeadless error persists and is triggered by the fcose layout, not the removed auto-fit() call. Nodes are created but not visible due to layout failures.

ui_bugs.issue: isHeadless error still occurs when Realign button triggers fcose layout.run()
ui_bugs.error_details: TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'isHeadless') at Core.headless -> boundingBoxImpl -> Layout.run
ui_bugs.impact: Layout calculations fail, nodes exist but are not positioned/visible

ui_bugs.issue: Nodes are created (nodeCount: 2) but not visible on canvas
ui_bugs.impact: Users cannot see nodes they create, making the mind map unusable

passed_tests: ✅ POSITIVE: No error overlay blocking the interface
✅ POSITIVE: Navigation works (Create New Map button functional)
✅ POSITIVE: Add Topic button works (nodes are created in DOM)
✅ POSITIVE: Physics toggle works without errors
✅ POSITIVE: Interface loads and is responsive
✅ POSITIVE: No React error boundaries triggered
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: The isHeadless error was NOT resolved by removing auto-fit(). The error now occurs in fcose layout when Layout.run() is called. Root cause: Cytoscape's Core.headless property is null when layout tries to calculate bounding boxes. Need to either: 1) Fix the headless property initialization, 2) Replace fcose layout with a different layout engine, or 3) Add proper error handling to prevent layout failures from breaking node visibility.

success_percentage.frontend: 30% - Interface loads but core functionality (node visibility) broken
